alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman; Haywood; Lauderdale; Madison; Shelby; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 3:49AM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, North Mississippi and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden, Lee and Phillips. In North Mississippi, Coahoma, DeSoto, Marshall, Quitman, Tate and Tunica. In West Tennessee, Crockett, Fayette, Hardeman, Haywood, Lauderdale, Madison, Shelby and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Marion, Brownsville, Millington, Covington, Ripley, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena, Memphis and Lakeland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Fayette; Hardeman; Haywood; Lauderdale; Madison; Shelby; Tipton
